Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: shell10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights mid april, staff were all really friendly and helpful. Hotel is well situated to shops, cafes bars etc and the water bus stop is a few minutes away. We had room 23 in the annex part of the hotel, room was ok, looked straight into another building so no daylight whatsoever got in. Otherwise it was clean although did smell a little stale. Bed was really comfortable and room cleaned every day. Bathroom was tiny, and the shower was the smallest little cubicle to wash in, also the hairdryer was so old it really had little effect!(wish i had taken one) These however are small complaints and i feel the hotel offered good value for money in venice, which is why we chose it. Breakfast was pleasant with lovely cheerful and friendly staff. The hotel itself and the area around also felt safe and comfortable to be in, which can be a worry when visiting a new place. Also for a good pint of guiness there is a lovely little irish bar just a long the street!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Alle Guglie”
Reviews.Author: bryan10king
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Alle Guglie and once again we were very pleased with the whole experience. This hotel is situated in one of the less touristy parts of Venice which we really enjoy - nearby are lots of reasonable restaurants and it is close to all the main waterbus lines including the Alilaguna. Getting there couldn't be easier. The staff, who have all been there for some time are so friendly and helpful, we look forward to another visit to our favourite relaxing city.

Reviews.Title: “honest review”
Reviews.Author: Alice B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have travelled a lot and have experience of many different types of hotels, we have stayed at Hotel Guglie twice and would go back again it is a very good hotel for the money, its location is amazing and you see how important this is when you see so many people with suitcases struggling to find their hotels which are not so close to piazzala Roma which is only 10 mins walk away and the beauty is that it is only 15 mins walk to San Marco and Rialto from the hotel. The hotel itself is very, very clean and beautifully decorated, the size of the rooms varies a lot as last year we had a large room but this year our room was very small. Breakfast is cereal, nice bread, jams, cheese, yogurt, cake, coffee, tea, juice more than enough to set you up for the morning seeing beautiful Venice. The staff are lovely people, very helpful and speak very good english, they were the same staff as last year, even the lovely lady who served our breakfast and cleaned our room so it felt nice to see the same faces. Reception is open 24 hours which is neccesary as the hotel has an annex which is next door. Outside the hotel are market stalls, shops and plenty of nice places to eat and drink. We will be staying here again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Davemurt
Reviews.Content: Can't find fault here,fantastic location only 5mins walk from train station,great breakfast that's a continental buffet and a very well price room. 10mins walk tom the Rialto and some great restaurantsnand bars close by,staff very friendly and allow luggage tombe stored on check out day as you continue sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Hemant P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March 2012 and found it to be a charming little place, with very friendly staff and great location. The room and the bed was very comfortable and everything worked well. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Max_hkxx2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel last June. It was hot. The air conditioner is not working well. The room is so small that we can't even find a place for our luggage. We have to move the furniture and make some room for our luggage. There is no lift so I have to carry my 26kg luggage to the 2nd floor where the steps are narrow & steep. The only advantage is the location. 10 minutes walk to the pier and the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality and Price!”
Reviews.Author: dvm_999
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very cozy, bed was very comfortable and shower was nice and hot. Hotel is situated very close to everything. All was basically within walking distance. The staff was great. They answered all questions and were always courteous! Great hotel! Good croissants in the morning as well! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find, nice rooms, good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: DavidandBrigid C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights in December, and we really had a great time. We were on the top floor (room 29), which was about 50 stairs up, but that wasn't really a bother. Our room actually had a double bed and another room with 2 twins (they must have run out of smaller rooms and put us in a family room instead). The bathroom was nice and clean, but the shower is really small. My 6-foot tall husband barely fit underneath the showerhead. It's also really easy to find from the train station, which was a relief, considering what a maze Venice is. The hotel is on a main street, so the street is filled with markets of fresh foods and souvenirs. Breakfast was really good. It's a buffet of muesli, cornflakes, yogurt, breads, croissants, cheese, and different cakes (depended on the day). The coffee was average, but we were comparing that to cappuccinos in Rome, which were amazing. We learned to get hot chocolate at breakfast, then head across the street for coffee at a FANTASTIC coffee shop called Torrefazione. A local recommended it, and I wish we'd found it sooner. Absolutely delicious. Back to the hotel ... helpful staff who spoke English well, clean rooms, and a great price. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise in Venice”
Reviews.Author: readyguy2k
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Alle Guglie is a great small surprise in Venice. The location is in Cannaregio, not more than five minutes, walking distance, from the Central Station Santa Lucia even if youâ€™re traveling with luggage like us. The owner (or manager) is very friendly as the whole staff of the hotel and service personnel. We have 3 rooms, 2 in the front and one in the back. All of them look like the photos they show on the site so you wonâ€™t be disappointed. The small details make each one unique (chandeliers, bath, and room decoration). Each room has a minibar (so you can stock some beers and a small safety deposit box for passports or net book. By the way, the one in the back have the best reception for the free WI FI. The breakfast is served on the third floor and I have to say that is very good (coffee, hot chocolate, cereals, toasts, yogurt, cheese, fruit juices, honey, marmalade, nutella and a salty canned meat). The ratio between price and quality is excellent. Itâ€™s hard to find an offer like that travelling on a budget like us ( trust me, we visited Rome, Florence, Venice and Milan).

Reviews.Title: “Had a happy and relaxed stay there”
Reviews.Author: Pietro1982
Reviews.Content: Simple and clean. Excellent location, especially if you get to venice late at night (very close to the bus/train station). Friendly staff. They kept my luggage and I could pick it up late at night as the reception is open 24/7. Wi-fi worked perfectly. Only negative point: to have breakfast in the morning we had to go out form the building where the room was and go in again, next door.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located, Nice, Clean and Confortable.”
Reviews.Author: Evaldo_Brazil
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to stay at this hotel. It is close to the train station, and located in the "main" entrance of Venice. Easy to find, clean and confortable. The staff was very helpful and spoke english. The hotel is well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skippy83
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel primarily for the location. We head that it's easy to get lost in Venice so we were very happy to find it so easily. It was less than 10 minutes from the train station and there was only one bridge to cross. The location was also nice because we got to walk around the island and explore on the way to the Rialto and St. Mark's. The room was clean and quiet - we faced another building across the alleyway. Breakfast was ok - coffee/cappuccino machine, pastries, cereal, yogurt, juices. The staff was accommodating - we were able to leave our bags for several hours while we did some sight seeing before our train left. Overall, it was a nice place to stay and affordable for a stay on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Easy location, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: MelanieKW
Reviews.Content: As everyone has pointed out, it was VERY close and easy to find from the train station, even with luggage. I also appreciated that we were staying rather far from St. Mark's Square because it meant we explored more of Venice than just that little corner. The room was small but clean, we had a view of the street (and into the windows across the street!), and the bed was moderately comfortable. They have the kind of bed which is two twins pushed together, but we didn't mind because they stayed put.The bathroom was clean and the water pressure in the shower was excellent! As everyone else said, the stairs were a little much but what do you expect? You really only need to take your luggage up once, and down once. They put a hold on the cost of the room with one credit card then we paid with another when we were there, and just as they said, the original hold was gone before we got home. We were a little concerned about that but it worked out fine.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard571
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay in Venice. We had a standard room on the first floor near to the breakfast area. The Hotel is well located for travellers with luggage - only one bridge to cross from the railway station, two bridges from the coach station and the water bus from airport can stop on the canal around the corner from the Hotel. We found the staff very helpful and friendly. We also found the public areas in our main building clean and tidy. Our room was also clean, quiet and generally met expectations although the bathroom was on the small side. There were no problems with the air conditioning which we were able to control ourselves. There was a TV but we never used it. Breakfast was plain and simple but perfectly adequate. We have just re-read the varied reviews on tripadvisor and feel that we have had a completely different experience to some of the Hotel's other guests who have entered negative comments. As the Hotel is obviously developed from two buildings (there are two separate entrances) perhaps it has a Jekyll & Hyde character! Our stay here was fine without any problems and we felt it was value for money. Venice is a lovely place to visit but it is a very expensive city. Nicer restaurants are found away from the main thoroughfare but again none of them are cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality/Good location.”
Reviews.Author: KellyHopes
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alle Guglie is a good qualtiy hotel for a visit to La Serenissima. The location is really good - located in the Cannareggio neighborhood in the historic district. The street outside of the hotel had a very nice fruit/vegetable market - ideal for picking up a snack to-go before a day of sightseeing/wandering. I room I stayed in was nice - decorated in classic Venetian style with beautiful green damask walls and a quaint little balcony over looking the street & market below - not the greatest mattress, not the greatest pillows - but a good bed nonetheless for laying my head down after a long day of walking. The hotel staff was helpful & friendly (especially when I needed to print out my museum tickets for la Galleria). I give this hotel a "very good" rating because things like breakfasts, A/C, bathroom size, etc. don't register on my list of imporant things. I did not come to Venice to critique my hotel, I came to see the city. I appreciated the hotel for what it was - a place to store my things during the day, stop in for a nap, and return for sleep at night. I would definitely recommend this hotel to future travelers to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, not advised if you can't walk stairs!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January for my birthday and again in March for my mums birthday. Very easy to reach if you come from the railway station, its a 15 minute walk. I adore this neighbourhood as it is one of the oldest in Venice, I love the bridges and un even pavement, some good shops as well as a daily fruit and vegetable market 2 steps from the hotel. It felt very safe to walk around at night. Only downside is I have not yet found a good non touristy place to eat close to the hotel. The hotel is small, intimate and friendly, had some problems with the tv only a couple of channels could be found. I don't advise this hotel for anyone who has difficulity climbing stair, there are many to climb here and quiet tight :-).

Reviews.Title: “avarage only”
Reviews.Author: Hamburger_Deern
Reviews.Content: The location in very good, the hotel is right next to the boat stop which brings you to the airport. The area is nice. If you leave the main road you will find quiet streets and nice bars and restaurants. The staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful!! I have not much postive to say about the hotel itself :-( The room and the bathroom was very small, the bed was ok... The breakfast was not good - the service was very friendly but could hardly compensate the "prison food"... the coffee was the worst we had during our two weeks in Italy.The room has aircondition but you can not regulate it yoursef. You have to ask the reception to turn it on of off for you.

Reviews.Title: “Took money, no room, partial refund”
Reviews.Author: jrissman
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience trying to reserve a room at Hotel Alle Guglie. Months in advance, I reserved a room which was secured via credit card. Shortly before my trip, the hotel contacted me to inform me that my credit card was denied. I used the same card for numerous other hotels and restaurants in Europe on this trip, and none of them ever had a problem with it. The most likely possibilities are that (1) someone at Alle Guglie didn't know how to operate their credit card equipment correctly, or (2) this was a tactic to try to cancel my reservation so they could re-book the room at a higher rate closer to the date of travel. I unwisely offered to pay by a different mechanism, and the hotel said that I could pay by wire transfer. (They refused to accept personal checks.) I paid the total they specified, plus the wire transfer fees charged by my bank. When the money arrived, the Hotel Alle Guglie's bank also charged fees, which they took out of the payment. The hotel told me that I would have to send another payment to cover their bank's fees (which would have required me to send another wire transfer and pay my own bank's sender fees again). I complained that I had paid the total they specified, and they should have informed me of their bank's recipient fees before I sent my payment if they wanted me to cover those fees. In response, the hotel immediately canceled my reservation. I complained to them a long time trying to get my payment refunded. They refused to refund the money by any method other than wire transfer. Eventually, they sent a partial refund, because they deducted the value of their bank's fees recipient fees as well as the fees for sending the money back. In the end, between all the bank fees, I ended up losing about 40% or 50% of the money I spent, plus I had to get a different hotel room at the last minute (which cost more than the one I reserved months in advance). I don't know if this was simply a terrible mistake or a dishonest attempt to get rid of my reservation so the room could be re-booked at a higher rate. Either way, I would never reserve a room with this hotel again. If you choose to book here, I recommend that you do not agree to send money except by credit card, and call them to make sure they can process your credit card successfully.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: Trace299
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure staying at Hotel Alle Guglie. It is situated on a busy market street, but we never really heard a lot of noise. The staff was very attentive and pleasant to interact with. The room we were in was of a good size - the view looked over a tiny courtyard in the back. However the bathroom shower was minuscule and the way the door is made to open on the shower did not help. Truthfully that was my only issue with the hotel. We were on the first floor and there was a very pleasant seating area there, that we hung out in a couple times during our stay. Travelers should be advised though, that it is not a handicap accessible hotel as there are no elevators in the hotel and all the rooms it seems (including the breakfast room) is located on the first floor or higher. The reception area though is accessible.

Reviews.Title: “It was fun”
Reviews.Author: Vivek S
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very warm and helpful. just AC was not working up to expectation and there was no remote given to reduce the temp

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room and service”
Reviews.Author: runjnee
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here with my husband and could not wait to leave. The room stank of wet dog and it was incredibly small - we had difficulty walking around without bumping into the furniture. The hotel advertised air conditioning but this has not been working for quite some time. The small window opened onto the next building and had no view or cooling effect. The head receptionist was very defensive about the hotel, without admitting that our objections might have merit. The buffet breakfast was a very poor experience after our lovely hotels in Florence and Rome. We were very disappointed with the hotel and would advise anyone against booking here - our Venice experience was completely ruined by it. And you are simply paying way too much for the low quality of the rooms and food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: jiho1
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with a friend in March 2011. It is only a ten minute walk from the bus and train station of Venice. When we were there, the vaporetto's (waterbuses) had a strike, so we were glad that we didn't have to take our heavy bags all the way through town (or take an expensive water taxi). The hotel itself is situated in a busy market street. We had a room on the second floor at the side of the street and next to the breakfast room. Althought the people from the market started to build their markets at about 6.30 am and the market stopped at 10 pm, it didn't give a lot of noise. Only on the first day the street noise troubled us, because the venetian carnaval had just ended and there were still some people partying. From the second day on, we were not troubled by any noise. The breakfast preparations started at 7 am and although the staff tried to prepare it in silence, it did give a little bit of noise and since we were in the room next to the breakfast room, it did wakes us up, but then again, we had more time to see Venice. Breakfast was pretty good, with some bread, toast, fresh fruit, even cake and cereals. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I don't think the building had an elevator, but that didn't bother us. The bathroom was a bit small, but very clean. From the hotel the whole city of Venice is within walking distance, with the Marco Polo Square at an approximately 20-30 minute walk. We had a great stay and if we are coming back to Venice, we would book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly hosts.”
Reviews.Author: Jude88
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 wonderful nights in the family room. Our teenage sons loved the loft bedroom. The rooms had great atmosphere and were handy to vaporetto stops. The pizza place on the corner was sensational! Management was terrific to deal with, from initial email queries through to check in. Would thoroughly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, convenient, good value”
Reviews.Author: N0AvailScreenName
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night when we flew I to Italy and then another two nights at the end of our trip. The first night, the room was small and low ceilinged, but very clean...bathroom looked recently remodeled. Currently back, writing from the hotel...have never written a review before but wanted to provide an alternative to the negative reviews. Our experience has been great. Now we are in a bigger room with higher ceilings...lovely and clean, small maybe for north American standards, but typical of European places we have stayed in. And, cost good...125 Canadian a night. We were able to turn the AC on and off last night...got cooler so we opened the windows...lovely windows...and our room DOES look like the pictures on the website...window opens to greenery, roof tiles at back. Hotel quiet, slept well, comfortable bed, laminated floors look clean. It is an old hotel that appears to be well kept and has charm. Breakfast was not as good as in other places we stayed, but certainly better than some we've stayed in in north America and in Europe. we were satisfied. Bathroom in second room much smaller than in first room, but room bigger in second. We walked all over Venice...no where is very far it seems in Venice, and being close to train and bus was perfect since we didn't have to drag our suitcases far.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here !”
Reviews.Author: Agrawalr03
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very small .... We could not even walk after putting our luggage... Staff were rude ... There was no air conditioning and rooms seemed very suffocating... A terrible experience in the entire trip... Not at all worth the money we paid for it ...

Reviews.Title: “Very misrepresented and don't believe the management responses!”
Reviews.Author: Rob_KW
Reviews.Content: First of all, don't believe the management responses and lean towards the reviews of the people. The people are unbiased Customers whereas the management obviously has something to lose (your business for making an educated decision based on real information... which is why we all use Tripadvisor). I say this because I see many management responses below which are discounting or denying what people have said that we have also seen first-hand ourselves and know to be true. Please make sure you look at our photos and the photos of others as pictures say it all. However, also note that Alle Guglie has posted many photos themselves and they show the place as being new and shiny and clean. Definitely not the case as you will see from true guest photos. Many of these are easy to identify because they come from their website. We could write many things about the disaster of Hotel Alle Guglie, but unfortunately only have limited review space. Here goes. First, the breakfast is NOT an amazing breakfast by any standards. My wife and I are very experienced travellers with 50 years of combined travelling experience to all parts of the world including less developed countries. So we have a good grounding on the wide range of standards and temper our comments according to the location and we review relative to the price and relative competition. The breakfast is the worst we have ever had in any European country in any level of hotel. Very limited food and cheap. We didn't even bother on the third day. Second, the air conditioning is NOT adjustable from the room. We were dying of heat in our room and went to politely inquire with the "helpful" staff about how to use the air conditioning. We were told it can only be adjusted from the front desk. I'm a professional engineer and I looked at the air conditioner in detail myself, and it definitely had NO adjustments and was also to my surprise improperly installed. They cut a rough hole in the wall and then just pushed the AC unit up to the hole. No hose, no seal. So a good majority of the hot air just recirculates back into the room. As for clean and in good condition? Any claim of that is a joke (refer to photos of mould and dust and hair everywhere). The hotel is a run down dump in a major state of disrepair. The carpets are so filthy they are black... they need regular steam cleaning. The majority of the room furniture is worn and often cracked with doors on failed hinges, etc. (see photos!). The rooms are pathetically tiny... and yes we know this is Venice and yes we expected the rooms to be small. This is normal in any old European city such as Paris and London. But Guglie has divided up their hotel into prison cells (another Customer told us he calls the place a Gulag prison and referred to his room # as a cell #). We could not move. We had no place for our suitcases. We had no room to walk around the bed. The bathroom dimensions were no more than 4 feet by 7 feet (see photos!). The worst problem is the mold. We actually stayed in two different rooms... first a regular room which had terrible air conditioning, was tiny, was loud (right outside breakfast room, and had paper thin walls). We complained to the "friendly" hotel staff and asked to simply check out the next day since we were so appalled and unhappy (we have never asked to leave a hotel for quality reasons ever before out of the thousands we have stayed at in life). They refused us... a very bad Customer service attitude by any standards. Instead, they insisted on moving us (remember the prison analogy?) to a "better" room. Yes this room was bigger, but it was also very run down. This was their "superior" room... superior with dirt and mold. The mold was so bad that the stench of it was overwhelming and we had to leave the door to the hallway open whenever we came back. I made the mistake of putting some of my clothes from my suitcase inside the dresser (with the cracked doors) and to my horror all my clothes picked up the mold stench and had to be cleaned at our next hotel. We sprayed the room with deodorant and tried everything. We would have loved to leave but were trapped in a bad experience. The source of the mold? We can only guess it was in the walls and the ceiling, but it came from the bathroom. And yes the hotel definitely knew about it (wait for the management response denying it however) because the maid also sprayed a deodorant in the room every day to try to cover it up without success. As for misrepresented, well we can debate this one with hotel management but you decide. Go to their website and look at the photos showing the hotel on the water. Look at their photos showing clean and new rooms. Then look at the real photos here. This is what any good Tripadvisor user does. This is what helps us all make good decisions and avoid scams so that we can enjoy our vacation and not throw away our hard-earned money. You will see in our photos the filth, the state of disrepair throughout the hotel, and the pictures of the place as it really is in June, 2011. The upstairs hallway looks nothing like their photos. Their is an old, broken CD player that hasn't worked for years. The chairs are sticky and dirty (steam clean if you really care management!), the floor boards are cracked and lifting. The list goes on and on... The free wifi is useless. Terrible coverage and you have to go searching for a spot somewhere in a hallway that actually has sufficient signal strength. You could turn this into a game for some entertainment to avoid staying in your room. Good things? The location is excellent, but then again if you take the time to research you will find many other hotels in the same location or close by and they are at similar price points or slightly more expensive. Many are truly on the water as well. Remember that Venice is actually fairly small and well connected by a good water transit system, so many locations are great. Any other good things to say? No. We have never been so determined to write a review ever before and we wrote this because we feel we were really misled and we were very upset. We really don't want other people to unnecessarily go through the same thing. To date, Tripadvisor has always served us well on hundreds of purchases and every other hotel we stayed at in Italy was what it claimed. We look for things like the ratings and the management responses because those typically mean that the hotel cares and is actively doing something. But I guess we learned from this experience that this isn't always the case and that it can simply be that the management has figured this out to their advantage. Something to be aware of next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: baseballplayer
Reviews.Content: How excited we were to find that our Hotel we chose because of the closeness to the train station was so very clean and inviting. Evrything about the Hotel was perfect, other then no English speaking channels that we could find on the TV. Typical small Venice hotel, but a very friendly staff and nice breakfast made the experience very pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place...”
Reviews.Author: mayankc
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this place as part of our Italy tour .... A decent place, if you dont want to spend huge money in Venice ...Be careful, Venice is an expensive city ! - The rooms were old venetian style, decent size - Bathroom was a bit on the smaller size, but manageable - Around 10 min walk from the Venice train station / city bus station (Tip: If you are coming by flight, you can catch an express bus service from Marco Polo to the city bus station. It will take around 40-45 min in bus. Its a pretty good service and cheap too) - If you do plan to come early from the check-in time, do remember to call up the hotel beforehand & let them know. Else, be ready to roam around until the place is ready. - However, the place do have a luggage area where you can keep you luggage after check-out - Breakdast was quite good; Its in a small room on 1st floor.

Reviews.Title: “Three Cockroaches (plus mold)”
Reviews.Author: runjonrun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June of 2011. About the only thing positive I can say about it was it had free high speed internet. We (my daughter and I) thought we would be able to use it from the room, but no. The reception wasn't strong enough, unless you stood up plastered at the door. Upon check-in the staff was nice and offered to help us take our bags up to our room, as there was no lift. When we entered the room, we saw the door had been partially kicked in and there was mold in the shower. The bed covers were simply a sheet and a paper - thin cover on top. The beds were rock hard as were the pillows. That night we got no sleep. You can hear conversations going on one or two rooms over. On top of that we had told reception to turn our air - conditioning off, as you cannot control the temperature from your room, and even after the second ask they didn't turn it off. So now with a freezing, loud, and uncomfortable room we tried our best to get the little sleep we did. Breakfast? Barely! The breakfast consisted of an airline meal. Simple, cheap, disgusting breads, some butter and cream cheese, and yogurt. The short - handed, one person staff would come by and offer you some coffee or cappuccino. Overall, not a good hotel and I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable tiny rooms, good location, awkward breakfast”
Reviews.Author: suzannedc
Reviews.Content: The location is very good-- short walk from train station, and good base for exploring. Some of the staff are helpful and professional. Pictures make the rooms look pretty, and some are, with nice headboards and wall paper. But even for Venice, the rooms are very very small, and the bathrooms (I saw several rooms as they had to move me) although very clean and new-ish, are almost uselessly tiny. In the bedroom there was no place nor even space for a medium-size bag, and I found it easier to crawl across the bed to get to other side as there was not really enough room to get around the bed, especially with the suitcase on the floor. This was true in both rooms I had. Perhaps a triple room, or a specially requested superior room would be different. I did feel the rooms were very clean, however. The other problem is that I could hear light coughing and other noises and conversations as though they were in my room, and in the morning I found that the noises were not next door, but several doors away, which was remarkable. The breakfast: a very difficult job for the two hard-working breakfast room staff. There are not enough seats/tables for most people to eat at same time in the small room, and of course this can be the case at many small hotels. But here the situation is not managed, nor anticipated (you don't know until you arrive to a crowded room with others waiting). It is a shame as they will make you a nice coffee of whatever type you order, and the breakfast has a lovely bread basket, cheeses, pastries and cereal. However, you feel you should hurry hurry and eat so that the waiting people in the cramped landing can have their breakfast also. It is a bit tense and awkward and claustrophobic, and the waitress is trying her best. If you manage to get a great rate, and you would like to be near the station (I think about ten minutes walk/3 bridges) and you are traveling alone and with a very compact bag, and can sleep through the conversations and noises from the other rooms, you may be just fine. Maybe a specially requested superior or triple room would be much better for space at least. I did however find other rather better hotels for the same rate nearby, and with water views even (both my rooms at the Guglie faced another window). One more thing which may be important to know: many of the rooms are up narrow stairs (I believe there is no lift) and there can be a lot of steep and narrow stair-climbing. I stayed at this hotel in January 2010, so to be fair, things may have changed. I doubt I would feel enthusiastic about recommending this hotel from my experience there last winter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location, very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mariann_61
Reviews.Content: We were 6 friends staying at this hotel. We had booked 3 superior rooms. They were decorated in original style, and were clean and tidy. Hotel was located both near the train station and water transportation directly to the airport. It was situated in a charming street with a fruit market, restaurants and shops, very central but not noisy, Friendly staff, simple, but good breakfast. We liked it a lot and can recommend it to anyone going to Venice. Not luxury, but a nice and central place to stay for exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely mis represented!”
Reviews.Author: Royce101
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the Internet are no where near close to what you are sleeping in. We are in a room that is 8 feet wide by 10 feet long. Air conditioning does not work and management basically says it is what it is. Web site says right on canal but not next to water at all. View is a cement wall or street. Don't even think about taking anything out if your luggage as there is no room to put it anywhere. Only thing great about this place is the wireless network is fast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful with good locations for train and airport”
Reviews.Author: Alberto055
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Hotel on May 8th to 1oth, when to London from Marco Polo airport, and return on Friday 13th. All the staff was excellent, specially Mrs,. Ilaria, that fill our check in with the airline and print the tickets. The hotel is six block from the Ferrovia Venezia Santa Lucia, and the bridge Alle Guglie that we have to cross with bagagge, have a side grade very helpful. From the hotel, we have at 60 meters, the Alilaguna Arancia line stop at Gugle station, that tooks as to airport in just one stop ( Madonna dell`Orto). The hotel keep our luggage withour charge, until we return from London, to help us not to travel with heavy luggage , really lovelly people.

Reviews.Title: “Frendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: GTA01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel Guglie on our vacations. There were beautiful days in very sympathetic room in old venecian style, with tapestryes and furniture with nature wood carving. It is very conveniently.\: you don't need wake up call-tower bell can wake you at seven o'clock and you will have a hour before breakfast. It's romantic. The personal are very frendly and careful. Hotel is small, but impression is great!

Reviews.Title: “Not what you are looking for in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Smagister
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night in this hotel. What can I say...the facilities are really pathetic. We had a room on a second floor with a main street view. Everything is very weary: air-condition is there, but out of order with an enormous amount of dust in it, so the smell is not fresh, Closet doors are barely hanging on their hinges, towels in the bathroom are stained with some dye - you might want consider that as dirty. No duvet covers on the bed: just a sheet and a duvet on top of it. We couldn't sleep all night, because it was terribly noisy in the street: during first part of the night people were dismantling their tents, during the second part they were setting them back. On top of that in the morning we discovered an ant nest under our closet with dozens of ants on the floor. They run away very quickly once you start walking - this is why you can't see them in the evening. And about the breakfast: it's not a buffet at all, in fact, you have something similar to an airline meal with lots of small packs of various stuff and a waitress offering you tea, coffee and juice. So, the bottom line is that this hotel should be avoided at any cost, and what we realized, having travelled to Venice, is that you have to either take a room in a reasonable hotel at a rate of 300+ euros or take a room in the mainland in Mestre, where you can get a reasonable 4-star hotel at about 100 euros and come to Venice by bus or a train (it's just 10 minutes). Unfortunately, it seems that there's nothing in the middle, except such hotels with dirty towels, ant nests in the rooms and terrible street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clevelandtravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Read all these reviews before I booked and am wondering if we were even staying in the same Hotel. It was old, dated and not as advertised in the pictures. No pretty tiled bathrooms, no nice clean white bathrooms either. No bathtub, no bidet, not even a toilet paper holder! They just set the paper on top of the toilet, gross! The room and bathroom were clean but the bathroom was tiny and the shower the size of a phone booth. The furniture in the room was worn and beat up, the room dark and depressing. The stairs going up to our room were very dirty and the little lobby on our floor had two chairs which were very stained and a hole and water stains on the ceiling. While I realize that in Venice it is hard to remodel, they could replace the furniture. The night staff person was pleasant but one in the morning was rude. Small selection at breakfast (worst of all our hotels in Italy) and itâ€™s in a small room and doesn't start till 8am, one day there wasnâ€™t even room for us to eat. One of the days we asked for a wakeup call at 6:30 and never got it, we woke up on our own and as we were walking out the door a little before 8 they called with the wakeup call-no apology when we complained. We were given a room in the building next door which I was told were the superior rooms! I asked since we were next door were the pictures on the website of those rooms in the other building and was told that all hotels put only the best room in the picture gallery and it is never accurate. Not true of our hotels in Rome, Florence or Trieste they all looked the same as the picture galleries. It is close to the train station but that is the only plus. It's also the little things that make a stay unpleasant like, the wireless only worked sporadically, no English channels on the tv, the hotel charges for a map of the city when every other hotel in Italy that we stayed at (4 others) offered free maps, wakeup call issues, unfriendly staff, etc. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: irregularchoioce
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and felt at home. the location felt like as if we were in a familiar village with the market stalls outside. Other local amenties included a wine shop where you could fill your own bottle for small money and a coffee house that ground it's own blend and served samples. Brilliant!The room was small but clean and as we spent little time there, adequate. Reception staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Breakfast was substancial with plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, but ...”
Reviews.Author: suemy303506
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, near the Santa Lucia railwail station, nice room, but on the top floor, and there is not elevator to reach it. We arrived in Venice on Sunday the 6 March, and there are many people in the streets, but the hotel was very quiet. The photo gallery shows how the hotel is. We recommend the hotel especially for the relation cost-benefit.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: rhinobasket
Reviews.Content: we stopped for three nights and were thoroughly delighted with our stay, the location is great , ten minutes gentle stroll from the bus- five minuted from the railway. We were welcomed, the receptionist offered to carry our bags. Quaint room, good views, overlooked street which we love, but still quiet at night.Fine , it wasn't big enough for a baseball match, but certainly on a par with the average for the UK in what I would consider the eqivalent range. Spotlessly clean , fresh towels and sheets every day without being asked.Bathroom spotless, with a bidet A little chipped paint here and there and the wallpaper may be eccentically Italian in places but if anything this all adds to the charm. Nice Continental breakfast. anything we we asked for done straightaway-i.e. extra pillows, unlocking safe someone had locked open etc. Plenty of good eateries around at all prices. This area is so much better than the hectic tourist hotspots- we could not wait to get back to Canneragio. Will be returning soon- but will stay away from the overpriced tourist tat round St Marks square and enoy a pleasant stroll , a good coffee and a the beautiful area around CanneragioI.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dana31g
Reviews.Content: We booked a double room during the Carnival. The room was small but elegant, very clean bathroom with bath tub and bidet, hot water. The TV had a broken remote, it was hard to browse through the channels. Breakfast was not too rich and the restaurant was small and cramped but also intimate . We would have liked the room to be warmer. The hotel is located well, you reach Piazza San Marco in about a 15 to 20 minutes walk. The plaster had fallen from the facade or shriveled, it needs renovation. Their staff do well their job but perhaps not as simly as in other parts of the world.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: cazmantis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location from the train station and I picked the place because it was good value for money with regards to where it was. Surprisingly when I arrived I was informed that there was free wi-fi throughout the hotel (was not expecting this as it had been marketed as a traditional guest house) so was very happy I was actually able to work in my room. Staff very helpful and patient as I had real problems trying to find out the best way to get to my business meeting but in the end I jumped on a vaporetto and arrived just fine. Quite a nice street view of a bustling Venezian street too so you feel in the heart of things. Think it's good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, fantastic people”
Reviews.Author: DigDagDug
Reviews.Content: The place was exceptional, from the kindness of its service to the generosity of their breakfast and its centrical location. It was great value for money, also. My girlfriend and me stayed there for 1 night and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Christinet09
Reviews.Content: Friendly, welcoming service. Hotel was full of charm. We were in attic room and had plenty of space for the two of us. We absolutely loved the way the room was decorated, with all the beams and classic venetian wallpaper. The area outside was really nice and it was a good location, not too far from St Mark's. This was our first visit to Venice and we loved everything about it! The breakfast was pretty good, nice continental style- we had plenty to eat. I would recommend this charming, friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff, recommended”
Reviews.Author: Brillo22
Reviews.Content: Staff were overall very frienndly towards us and were always ready to help. The room itself was quite compact but it everything that was needed and the shower was very good. the breakfast was good and there was a large selection of rolls, cereal and fruit. The service at breakfast was first class with the staff always there to help. Overall I would recommend the hotel to anyone going as it has a very good location to everything and overall we had a very enjoyable stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alle Guglie a little gem.”
Reviews.Author: shoshana4
Reviews.Content: This hotel is warm and friendly. It is in a wonderful position, close to the Ghetto and with an easy walk to catch a vapareto to all parts of Venice and Murano. They serve a traditional Italian breakfast which really starts your day well. The staff are so helpful and kind, nothing was too much trouble. This really is a little gem of a hotel and we will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back again”
Reviews.Author: portiachong
Reviews.Content: 1. The location is very good . Just 5 minutes from the railway station. 2. The cleanliness is good and we like the bathroom is neatly and the hot water is sufficient. 3. Breakfast is quite good and the attendant is friendly and helpful. 4.The staff in reception are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother staying here”
Reviews.Author: bikerbop
Reviews.Content: Our room was satisfactory since we were there only to sleep. The bathroom was incredibly small and the shower in an inconvenient location. The hotel's location was fine as it's located near the vaporetto. However, their site claims to have an airport shuttle. Don't be fooled. That's the public boat. They do not have their own dock or shuttle. The staff wasn't very cordial nor did they offer luggage help. Earlier in the trip we stayed at a lovely place near the Rialto and would definitely return there again. I wouldn't return or recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Nunu_10
Reviews.Content: August in Venice. Booked the hotel after searching for it in google maps - turns out it was the best we could expect for the price we paid! our room was ancient style but the bathroom modern and very clean. the kids got their own room in the attic, but it was large enough. the market just below was a plus, the windows were thick and we didn't hear a thing. Breakfast was just enough for us. Croissants, bread, butter, jams, Nutella, muzli, coffee, milk, juice, yogurts, etc. very close to the Jewish Gettho, "bus" station and market.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: zlw31
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner have just returned from 4 days in Venice and a stay at the Hotel Alle Guglie. We booked the hotel due to the reviews that have been given on Tripadvisor. The Hotel is approx 10mins walk from the train station and you only have to cross one bridge. The Alle Guglie vaporetta stop is also just around the corner. We stayed in Room 22 which is in the building next door to the reception area and is at the back of the Hotel looking out over a small courtyard. The room was extremely clean and a decent size and had a wardrobe and desk. There was also a TV (no English channels), a small safe and a fridge. The bathroom, although clean, was very small. Towels and the usual toiletries were available. Breakfast was continental and consisted of the usual pastries, bread, cheese, cereal, yogurt etc. Juice and coffee was available. The lady who serves you was extremely pleasant and always smiling. She kept the area very clean and tidy. We would definately stay here again - Hotel Alle Guglie is a good value hotel in a great location with friendly and helpful staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and quality boutique hotel with an economical price.”
Reviews.Author: BethDolojan
Reviews.Content: Our stay in the hotel had been very pleasant. The staff was very nice and accommodating. The place was also clean and we did not experience bed bugs nor mosquitoes inside the hotel. The location is just right in the middle of everything - train station, taxi and bus stations, shopping, restaurants, tourist spots, etc. To top it all, the establishment has very honest staff. They contacted us immediately when they found out we had left a jewelry item behind. The breakfast they served was also filling and we had very good choices. We will recommend Hotel Alle Guglie to all our family and friends and when we go back to Venice, we will surely stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located, Economical, Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelenMcNeill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just stayed at this hotel and were really impressed. The rooms, though not huge, were very nicely decorated and fitted out. The small shower rooms are pristine with modern fitments. The continental breakfast was fresh and the coffee good. The area the hotel is in is close to the railway station and has a vaparetto stop nearby. Within a ten minute walk you can find yourself away from the crowds eating at small seafood restaurants that do not charge the earth - a carafe of house red wine for 12 euros. So to sum up - good location and good quality for a good price!

Reviews.Title: “This is our second stay at Alle Guglie, it suits us very well.”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterKate
Reviews.Content: Alle Guglie Hotel is in an excellent busy untouristy location so convenient for the vapporetto stops and within easy walking distance of most special places. The hotel is immaculately clean; our bedroom was smallish but lovely with a view onto the street; much better than room 26 which we stayed in previously.The 24 hour reception staff speak English well and are very helpful.The lovely hard working breakfast lady must have a special mention. In our very late 70's we found the stairs a little difficult especially when moving our cases on arrival and departure.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: trackie3009
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for August Bank holiday and was so surpirsed to have got a hotel so nice at great value. It was a great find and couldn't ask for a hotel closer to the hub of Venice. Staff friendly and helpful. Had problems with a hairdryer which was quickly replaced whilst we were out enjoying the sights. Rooms were clean and tidy, great to have aircon that works. Although breakfast was basic that was my own preference and you can't please everyone. Will definatly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Good location & service”
Reviews.Author: holidaycouple_20100
Reviews.Content: very central location, small but very nice and clean rooms in venetian style, very good bathroom, breakfast is fine and employees very friendly, 24h reception service, central location. We really enjoyed our 4-day-stay in August 2010!

Reviews.Title: “I did it again!”
Reviews.Author: ClinkerFrankfort_KY
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Alle Guglie. I chose it again because of the location and it's friendly family atmosphere as well as it's cleanliness. The room was comfortable and the bathrooms had been updated since my last stay. The continental breakfast was delicious. The location was great for walking, eating, shopping, etc. I loved looking out the windows and seeing the fresh outdoor market appear before my eyes. It lacks an elevator; otherwise, this is a great place to stay in Venice. Luigi makes you feel welcome and right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: ebaegalre
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is close to bus, train, water bus. The room was clean. The staff was great. Room was very comfortable. Our stay in Venice was Great.

Reviews.Title: “An average bed&breakfast”
Reviews.Author: honest789
Reviews.Content: I had been misled by all the positive reviews to book a superior room at this hotel. When we arrived we got a very standard room in all senses (and as it usually happens, nothing like the superior rooms on the hotel's website). Staff insisted this was a superior room - despite being obviously featured as standard on the website - ending with a 'I'm sorry but that's it, the hotel is full, the website people may have got this wrong', all the usual lame excuses. As disappointing as this was because our expectations were high, finally, after three arguments - without any proactivity on the receptionist's side - we were charged for a standard room. As such, the hotel was average, the standard room was average size, with a standard bathroom, decoration was ok with rather aged furniture, two single beds, average in comfort, bunked together. Breakfast was ok and the breakfast lady was lovely. I have to say this was an annoying experience certainly affecting the overall feeling of the minibreak negatively. If I had known this, I would have happily paid a little more for a 4* without the hassle. Judge for yourselves, but I'm certainly not staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price for budget minded travelers”
Reviews.Author: SDFamily5
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay in mid-May before our cruise departure, and chose this hotel for the location as it is close to the train station and port. We were pleasantly surprised on how nice this hotel is! The hotel is in a very great area, with a fresh food market right out front, convenient location, with a short walk to water taxis, and a pleasant walk to the Rialto Bridge and San Marcoâ€™s square. Although the rooms are small, the one we stayed in had a queen sized bed and a small bathroom with a stand up shower, however it was extremely clean. Not much room for much else except for our luggage, but the bed was extremely comfortable. You donâ€™t expect to be in your room that much if you are in Venice as there is so much to do and see there. The hotel is very easy to find from the train station, but it is always a challenge to find your way back after negotiating the streets and bridges as you make it back from San Marcos, but that half the fun of Venice. The continental breakfast was very good, and the severs were very nice and kept the tables clean. The staff at the front desk was both very helpful with directions and spoke excellent English. If you are on a budget this is an excellent choice, do not expect modern conveniences like an elevator, flat screen TV, or 24 hour food service, but this hotel is very clean, the staff exceptional nice and in a great neighborhood in Venice. Exceptional value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Pierrefromsweden
Reviews.Content: Booked the familly room wich is located in the building next to the reception. The decoration is NOT as fancy as in the hotel pictures. However is was perfect for our familly. You need some gym skills in one of the 2 rooms to access one of the beds because it is not possible to stand normally. Good location i Venice if you are looking for a less touristic part of the city. Located 100 meter from the vaporetto station.

Reviews.Title: “That was great stay, lovely staff, nice room, perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: LaetitiaUk
Reviews.Content: Venice was great apart from one thing, you are not wealthy you are treated like [--]! But at the Hotel Alle Guglie you really feel like a star! All the staff is solovely and very attentive to your needs!! The location is great, situated in a nice little street just above a market, you can feel the life of Venice right under you window ;-) Rooms were great and very clean. All I want to say is a very big thank you to all the staff of the Alle Guglie Hotel as they made our stay brilliant, a special thank you as well to the lady who prepares the breakfast, you have a lot to do and you are doing a really great job smiling to everyone all along!!! Thanks again our stay wouldn't have been so great without you! ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely character and service”
Reviews.Author: bentxgholden
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good area of Venice. Very quiet at night, but then isn't all Venice quiet at night?? The room was a good size (we had a room right at the top level) and tastefully decorated. It looked like the bathroom was recently renovated which was good, except the shower was TINY and considering the size of the bathroom probably could have been a bit bigger to make it more comfortable. The staff were very helpful, particularly on the last day when we were checking out and had to pay for the mini bar. We didn't have the right cash and they didn't have enough change so they raced off with our money to break it down for us. Very good. Breakfast was very basic but I it was included so it was ok. The only downside would be having to cart your luggage up about 5 flights of stairs - that was hard work.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel alle Guglie - I can reccomend it to everybody!!”
Reviews.Author: tenor1983
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in the hotel on March 2010. what can I say? A wonderfull and helpfull stuff and atmosphere. Not big, but very nice and stylish rooms, which bring you immediately into the old Venice style and feeling... The rooms are very clean, and the breakfast is simple and nice and you will never finish it, so you'll not stay hungry... The location is in the center but nit too crawded, which I liked very much. There are some totaly amazing ;ocal restaurants arround (mostly for Italians, tourists hardly can find it), on the back street, just ask Francesca or somwbody alse on the reception, It will be an unforgettable dinner... The street is close to the Grand chanal and there are lots of incredible churches arround, just walk and enter each of them. On the last day you can leave your laggage in the laggage room of the hotel, free of charge. There is also a TV and free wi-fi internet connection. Next time in Venice- we will stay in this hotel again. Thank you very much for the great vacation and service! :) Mille grazie. Tatiana and Dmitry Gishpling

Reviews.Title: “Love this area of Venice - Good quality hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: feefeefifi
Reviews.Content: I would def recommend this area of Venice and this hotel. You can get a real feel of 'everyday' life of Venetians just a street away. Main sights fairly closeby. The hotel is a good 3* with small room but thats typical. Pretty good breakfast by Italian standards. Helpful staff. Easy to access train station and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: marmaduke33
Reviews.Content: The area looks a bit rough on arrival compared to say St Mark's Square, but that's because it's a Venetian residential area and therefore very interesting and less pricey than major tourist areas. The desk staff are friendly and helpful (on duty 24 hours a day). The room was small and had a view of an inner courtyard, but you're only going to be in there to sleep! On the plus side, it was spotlessly clean, the bed was huge and comfy and the shower was fantastic. Breakfast, much as you'd expect but plenty of it and served in a nice room. Absolutely no bad comments to make.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: woogie8305
Reviews.Content: I only have praise for the Alle Guglie. I took my girlfriend to venice and not really knowing what to book i came across this hotel and picked it from what other reviews i read. Its in a perfect location, with the water bus, water taxi, gondula and train station all within a 3 minute walking distance. San Marco square is about a 15-20min walk away and this is an easily enjoyable walk with the wonderful views and shops you past on the way. The breakfast supplied was always amazing in taste and presentation, the hotel provide you with your own safe in the room and the room itself was beautifully decorated with traditional venetian style! Fresh towels and sheets were supplied every day as you would expect and the general cleanliness of the whole hotel was impeccible. The staff were fantastic as was the manager who all m,ade sure we had everything we needed!

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem in the City"”
Reviews.Author: jmarb
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed with Hotel Alle Guglie many times, we visit Venice 3 times a year for both pleasure and now business. We have tried many Hotel's in the City but have now found a "Gem". The location is is so easy to walk to from the Bus Station and Train Station with only two bridges to walk across, something you need to think about when you have luggage! The Hotel is on a main street but when in the rooms at the front of the hotel its quiet. The rooms are very roomy considering the age of the building. The bathrooms are very well designed and the rooms are cleaned to a very high standard. The staff are friendly and will do anything to help, they are some of the best staff that we have meet. the walk from the Hotel to Rialto Bridge and San Marc's is a lovely walk, it only takes 10/15min quick walk. We have recommend Alle Guglie to friends and family and those that have stayed with them have been more than pleased and have found the Hotel very easy to find. You will not find a better hotel in the city for the price, location, cleanliness, service and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: MiriamBR
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an interesting neighbourhood, with nice restaurants and little shops, but it is not really very close to San Marco square - it will take you about 20 minutes on foot to get there. It is nice to stay away from the more touristy area, but if you are on a tight schedule in Venice, I would suggest staying closer to the center. The room was in need of some restoration, and it was located on the third floor, with no elevator. Breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel close to Train Station and Guglie pier”
Reviews.Author: The_Holiday_Couple
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Rooms are clean and are done up in a traditional but nice way - Location is good if you are looking for a reasonable place close to the train station - The Guglie pier is adjacent to the hotel that has commuter waterboats (vaporeto) just in case you are tired of the walking - The hotel staff speak good English and are helpful - The street (a little ahead) is lively till late. There is a "Frulala" stall walking distance from the Hotel that was serving cocktails till about 1am Cons / some considerations: - There is no elevator, so ask for a room on one of the lower floors at the time of booking - The St Marks Square (the happening city centre) is at least a 20 minutes walk; if this is a concern for you then look for some other place. We were happy staying closer to the station and the walk was fine with us - The complimentary Breakfast had very limited options, but was still not bad to get us started for the day. The breakfast room is small and only has about 8-10 tables. There was only one staff catering to all the tables. So there service on this occasion was a bit lousy. Overall, we thought it was good value for money compared to the other awfully expensive hotels in Venice (We crosses a few of those on our way from the station to Alle Guglie). But if you are looking to be near the St Marks, this may not be best suited for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location away from the main tourist areas”
Reviews.Author: Val47
Reviews.Content: This hotel served our purposes very well. We had been a little hesitant about remarks made about the market outside the hotel but we felt that this added to the atmosphere and did not consider it to be noisy. The hotel was easy to find (especially if you arrive by train), the staff spoke good English and were pleased to help with local information. We would be more than happy to stay there again. The room, although clean, could never be descibed as spacious; in fact the bathroom was little more than a cubicle but as tourists the hours spent there are minimum. The breakfast was more than adequate as long as guests do not expect the choice offered by the large chain hotels. Venice was stunning and the Cannaregio area is particularly interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, value, and location!”
Reviews.Author: Gentilleschi
Reviews.Content: Despite the lack of elevator, I really enjoyed staying at this hotel (3 nights). The service was excellent, and I never saw a single employee look unhappy to be there. They were super helpful and friendly, and the hotel has a great atmosphere. Our double room was quiet, well air-conditioned, and newly renovated. We had enough space, and the washroom was immaculate (with the usual cubicle shower, as is extremely common). Breakfast was a lot better than other hotels we stayed in during our time in Italy, and yes the breakfast room is small, but it's cozy and welcoming and we never had to wait to eat. Balcony doors open up so you can look out onto the street from above. Coming in from the train station, it took under ten minutes to walk there; yes, there is a bridge to cross, but there is a ramp on this bridge that means you don't have to carry your suitcase over, but can pull it. Being close to the train station and road to the mainland, I would suggest walking maybe ten minutes north from the hotel along the main canal to sit on the edge of the island that you can see the bridge to the mainland from. It's an absolutely gorgeous place to watch the sun set from. On my next visit, I will absolutely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Venice exploring”
Reviews.Author: disgrun
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel located near the Ponte delle Guglie bridge in Venice, close to the train station and the Ghetto area. The hotel is easy to reach from the station, about a 5 to 10 minute walk which is pretty easy except for the only bridge, which is a pedestrian bridge and may give you trouble if you have heavy bags to lug over it. The hotel is in a great location if you are coming from Marco Polo airport, since the Alle Guglie vaporetto stop is a 30 second walk from the hotel and is the second stop on the Alilaguna line from the airport. Avoid the water taxis, which are a rip off! Positives: The rooms are of a normal size, the beds are comfortable and the hotel is very clean, with lots of cleaning staff active. The breakfast room is tiny, but the breakfast is a good continental one â€“ coffees, Italian 'fette tostate' toast and jam, and cereals and fruit bowls available, as well as yoghurt. The hotel staff allowed us to drop our bags there for the day on our last day in Venice. Negatives: There is no internet access, which in the 21st century is disappointing! Also, what other reviews say about the stairs is true â€“ we were on the fifth floor, which was a real hike up narrow stairs to the top, dragging our suitcases behind. Also, the rooms have air con but our room was very hot when we reached it, because the air con had been switched off all day. This being August, the room was like a sauna, and it took a few hours for the temperature to drop. The bathroom, however, had no air con and it always felt like we were getting steamed! Lastly, the hotel can be hard to find the first time, as it has an entranceway without big signs â€“ as a tip for future travellers, walk a few seconds up the road from the Alle Guglie bridge, towards the San Marco direction, and it will be on your right just before the market stalls.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small rooms but good location”
Reviews.Author: Lady1971
Reviews.Content: There is nothing more to this hotel than location since it is very close to the train station but that is where the plus stops. When we arrived in August (HOT) we had to carry our own suitcases to the 2nd floor (no elevator) and then we got this double room which is the tiniest double room I have ever seen. Attached to the room was an ever tinier bathroom with the tiniest tiniest shower corner that I have ever experienced (aren't there any laws about basic minimum measurment?) The air conditioner was a portable one and did not cool the room. The breakfast room is tiny with only 6 tables so you might need to wait for your turn. All in all not worth the price!!

Reviews.Title: “For my next stay in Venice I'll definitely choose this hotel, because...”
Reviews.Author: jse81
Reviews.Content: - although the rooms are really tiny (ours was about 10m2 including the bathroom), they are newly renovated, well equipped and nicely furnished. - the rooms are quiet - at least ours was. As our room was right next to the breakfast room, I asked if we could have another one, which was not possible, because the hotel was fully booked. In the first night I slept with ear plugs in order not to get woken up by the kitchen sounds. However, it was not loud at all and in the following nights I slept without ear plugs. - all the staff was very nice and welcoming - breakfast is ok, for a three star hotel in Venice I would even call it marvellous - it is wonderfully located. I arrived by water bus from the airport (orange line, second stop coming from the airport, station is 50 m from the hotel), the friend I was travelling with by train (not even a 10 min walk from the train station and only one bridge to cross). Several water bus lines stop not far from the hotel. A nice stroll of about 25-30 minutes to S. Marco. - the area the hotel is located in has a very good infrastructure, but is not as super touristy as San Marcvo or Rialto - having been to Venice many times this hotel is definitely the best value I ever got We stayed there in July 2009 and payed 100â‚¬ for a double room with breakfast. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody, except to travellers with physical disabilities. The stairs are very narrow, there is no elevator and the rooms are tiny. But still, "alle Guglie" will be my first choice in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fabulous location, extremely welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: michael_cervenka
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights. Great hotel, fabulous location (proximity with train station, fruit & vegetable markets, fish market, 15 min walk to main square, lots of restaurants and quieter areas, etc.), good modern facilities (shower, bath, etc.) & very clean, fantastic breakfast and all staff extremely welcoming. Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, quirky and just the right scale”
Reviews.Author: khamiis
Reviews.Content: Spent an enjoyable break at this quiet and very clean hotel during spring 2009. Its location in Cannaregio is perfect for getting away from the hustle and bustle of the main islands of Venice and you really have a flavour life with the markets and locals shopping outside. The breakfast had a good variety of pastries and cereals and you can eat until you are full. The waitress was straight forward, efficient and polite. The staff were very freindly without overbearing. There are drawbacks, with unusual layout and smallish rooms...however I think this adds to the experience of Venice. Venice itself is made of strange long alleys and bridges etc and the hotel is in many ways an extension of that. I loved it and would definately come back

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoodsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in May 2009 and found this hotel to be ideal for a short stay in Venice. There are no frills but when you are out all day that is not a problem. The continental breakfast was ample, the room was clean, tidy and confortable and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location is good too. A quieter area of Venice but within easy walking of the main attractions. Some nice restaurants very close by, much cheaper than around St Marc's.. Hotel is only ten minutes walk from railway station and central bus station which is where we arrived from the airport. Would stay here again if we return to Venice. Very nice and enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Oh for want of an elevator”
Reviews.Author: vjha
Reviews.Content: We booked this property for its supposed proximity to the Venice Railway Station. Reaching there we realized the area was replete with hotels. It is a nice place, but we had a few bags and they gave us a room on the top floor. Lugging them up there after the trip from the station was not fun. On the whole, the staff was nice, breakfast looking out on the street was very nice and the rooms and bathroom were clean and tidy. If they had an elevator, it would have been great. For the price, they should have one. Or at least warn the potential guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellyshoo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights and would definitely use it again. The rooms were large compared to where we stayed before in Venice. Decor was traditional Venetian and rooms were clean. We were very near the breakfast room but noise was not a problem. The breakfast was very nice, jam filled croissants, bread roll, cheese, yoghurt, french toasts, cereal, bread/toast and on two mornings a very nice jam tart. A choice of coffee, tea or hot chocolate, the cappucino was lovely. It didn't take long to walk to the hotel from the bus station and not too long to st Marks. The restaurant opposite the hotel was quite nice as were all the restaurants we went to in this area, unlike those near St Marks. There was no kettle in the rooms and no hotel bar, which was a little dissapointing. The bathrooms were very nice and the heating worked well. None of our party had any compaints about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: NiceRyde
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel to be very good value, spotlessly clean, the welcome friendly. It is in an excellent location, an easy walk one bridge from the train station and central for visiting all parts of Venice. The decoration of the public areas and rooms are beautifully Venetian. We certainly plan on staying there our next trip to Venice and highly recommend this small hotel where management and staff pay such personal, helpful attention to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming room, wonderful staff! We'll definitely return next time we're in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: sajb
Reviews.Content: Well, my title kind of gives away how we felt about this hotel. It was very near to the train station, and about a 20 minute walk to St Mark's square. The hotel consisted of two buildings, the left side, which contained the reception, and the right side which appeared to be newer (we stayed in this part). The room we stayed in, while a bit on the small side, was tastefully decorated, and equipped with TV, AC and a minibar. Breakfast was simple, but sufficient and the staff were very friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: honig5
Reviews.Content: Just a 2-minute-walk from Vaporetto-stop Guglie, a lot of Bars and Restaurants around. The Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are clean and cozy, also the bath. Breakfast with Toast, rolls and croissants, cheese, honey and jam. We had a nice time and would gladly come back. Greetings to Luigi.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Kevinandhelena
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a good location, 10 mins walk from the train station and close to water bus stop. On main walkway from train station to St Marks square but still quiet at night. Check in very friendly and helpful although we had to carry our suitcases up 3 flights of stairs. We stayed in December and it was very cold, the room only has a noisy fan heater. Breakfast service was disappointing as we were pretty much ignored on our first morning.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little gem!”
Reviews.Author: puxadoraz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated rather near the main train station or airport bus drop, so even if you arrive late at night, you can reach there two bridges and 10 minutes later. The hotel faces a wonderful shopping district full of affordable clothing stores, pattiseries, charming groceries shops and pizzerias. Unfortunately, there are no lifts, which adds to the charm of the whole place BUT is a hassle when you are lugging a huge suitcase! I had only one grouse with the place. When I emailed the hotel, asking if the VENEZIA METRO is near the hotel, they mixed it up with the Santa Lucia Metro and told me that it is 5 minutes away when in fact, you have to take the metro or a bus to reach it. Based on their misinformation, I booked a 3am train ride to Florence an had some trouble getting to my train! Apart from that, the staff was excellent, polite and accomodating, just double check the information you receive from them. Will I stay again? Most likely!

Reviews.Title: “Venice is gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: jlvetock
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Venice and stayed here. The hotel is within walking distance from the train station with only one bridge to cross. It took us only 5 minutes with a 3 year old in tow. We did have to walk up a lot of steps to get to our room but I kind of expected that (are they really going to add elevators to these beautiful old buildings?). The staff were really nice, especially to our daughter. The rooms were small, as expected, but there was plenty of space for us and our daughter had her own room of sorts (making it much easier at bedtime). The breakfast was average continental fare--mostly toast, cereal, yoghurt. You did have to go into the other building for breakfast but that didn't really bother us. The dining room was small and on two of the days they were full and people had to wait to sit (luckily not us). It is a 15 minute walk to San Marco but if you do it right you get to see some spectacular places on the way (Rialto Bridge/Accedemia Bridge)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a great location”
Reviews.Author: Morgan068
Reviews.Content: Over the years Iâ€™ve been to Venice many times with friends or family who are visiting and so have had the chance to try out quite a few hotels in Venice. This hotel is certainly one I will be going back to. The location is excellent, just a short walk from the station with plenty of restaurants, bars and shops nearby. We found the staff very pleasant and friendly, and the room, although not particularly big, was exceptionally clean and comfortable. The breakfast provided was more than adequate with plenty of choice so something to suit everyone. All in all, we found it very good value for money and would highly recommend it. Sheila, Italy

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Gorgeous2000
