Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location - 5 mins away from the Ferrovia, the railway stn and Grand Canal vaporetto stop and 2 mins away from Ponte Guglie vaporetto stop. Altough the hotel was on a main thoroughfare (lots of shops, trestaurants, fresh fruit stalls) the double glazing shielded you from any noise. The staff were incredibly friendly and the continental breakfsst was more than sufficient. We took the hotel up on their free tour to Murano and a private taxi duly arrived the next morning to pick us up (you have to make your own way back by vaporetto). The taxi ride was a great substitute for those who are a bit unsure of gondolers. We had the quadruple family room at the very top of the hotel - the stairs were a nightmare for a not very fit fatty like me making me very organised for fear of forgetting anything in the room but could be prohibitive for some. The room was exceptionally clean with a small dressing area separating the two bedroom areas. The second bedroom area with twin beds had a seriously sloping roof - the second bed could only be reached by climbing over the first. We all bumped our heads over the course of the 5 days and my 12 year old took half the skin off his spine standing up to quickly - I certainly wouldn't recommend this room for teens upwards sharing with adults. I'd also be a bit wary recommending this room to those with very young children as the door opened straightout onto the staircase and the dressing area also had about 4 steps leading up to it. The bathroom was tiny - a bit challenging getting in and out of the shower (skinny folk shouldn't have a problem) and opening right on to the double bed in the main bedroom area making things a little odour-challenenged in the morning. Despite all the issues mentioned above I would return to this hotel as it has alot going for it - we never spent very much time in our room because there was so much to do and see and as such, it made a great little base. Great location, friendly staff, good value, very clean, a decent breakfast - you can live with the short comings of the room

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel with some fixable problems but we enjoyed our stay nevertheless”
Reviews.Author: lovetoscribble
Reviews.Content: Room 21 - The Good things: room decor (elegant, traditional Venetian); the breakfast was good (for Italy - the country of yucky, sweet buns for breakfast) and they actually gave you some yoghurt and real bread and fantastic capuchino; the friendly staff; the location (train station just a few minutes away)excellent for Eurail Pass travellers; bathroom was clean and linens were crisp and clean; hot water and good water pressure; price was good for Venice (high prices there); room was quiet at all times and did not need to close the shutters Neutral:The view from the window was a tiny, grim courtyard, but since Venice is crammed tight, in any building the view will only be good from the front windows. The floor sagged dreadfully near the bathroom door - it's an old building but that could be fixed. The Bad: The room stank when we first entered. To me it smelled as if there had been a bed-wetter in the room; to my husband it smelled of sewer. Left windows open and smell dissipated by day two. The lamp on one side of the bed was missing - so if you like to read or are night blind and need to find the bathroom in the dark you are out of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: jjmunck
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided all our needs for our two nights in Venice. Staff could not have been more helpful. Our room was rather small, but you have to expect that in Venice. It seemed reasonably expensive, but we realise that for Venice, it was quite well priced. The hotel was very quiet, or at least our room at the back was, though from the breakfast room facing the street, it was also quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leanne_ham
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights stay at Hotel Alle Guglie in Venice and I thought it was a good hotel. For the price we payed I was very pleased with the hotel, you get what you pay for at the end of the day. The room we were in was quite small but we don't spend much time in the hotel so that wasn't a problem for us, the room was cleaned to a very high standard every day. The hotel is ideally located and you can reach all the main sights easily on foot, it's not far either from the main bus terminal from the airport. The staff are very friendly and speak good English, the breakfast was nice and there was plenty of it, the breakfast room however was small so you had to get there not too late as you run the risk of having to wait for someone to finish before you can eat. I was surprised though as there is a room (number 31 I think) that is adjoined to the breakfast room and I would not like to have been placed there as you would have been woken up every morning by the clatter of plates from the lady getting ready for breakfast! During our stay the hotel was being refurbished so there were workmen hammering and plastering but we were up early and out and they were finished by the time we returned to the hotel so this wasn't a problem for us. Overall this hotel was great value for money and I was really pleased we stayed here, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect compromise”
Reviews.Author: UbertVosges
Reviews.Content: The staff is definitely friendly and speaks excellent English. The rooms are clean and the breakfast is very good. Beside, the location is excellent with everything in a short walking distance. The price is also quite a lot below what I would have expected for any hotel with the same standing in Venice. This hotel is the perfect compromise for any good stay in this city for lovers.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: arsoo
Reviews.Content: We are just back from our three nights holiday in Venice.We stayed at Alle Guglie and we didn't face any problems in hotels services.Staff is very friendly and ready to help 24 hours.The rooms are not that great, are in need of maintainence.But maybe this is what you get in Venice in this price.The room was cleaned everyday.The breakfast service is all right.The lady serving breakfast can't speak English,but understands the necessary words.Overall an average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable”
Reviews.Author: Oracle334
Reviews.Content: We got a reservation on short notice, it was the least costly of any 2 or 3 star place on the internet site we used, and I'd say it was average, meeting our needs (considering Venice's reputation for high prices). Location was great for us, breakfast provided was decent, staff was friendly, fairly helpful. Just can't wrap my mind around 136 Euro per night for a cramped double during what used to be a kind of low season in Venice, but there may not even exist a low season there anymore!

Reviews.Title: “ALL GOOD *****”
Reviews.Author: chrisjohnbarnes
Reviews.Content: We travelled with Ryanair to Traviso airport, which was easy, on time and really cheap ! At the airport, there were buses outside waiting to take people to venice bus park, the closest road to the centre, this cost about Â£5 return, it took about 30 mins but they do say allow 1 hr 10 minutes ! Its got to be the easiest and cheapest way ! The Hotel was about 5-10 minutes walk from the bus park, so straight away you get to see some of Venice but pack light unless youve got someone else to carry your stuff ! You can get water taxis to your hotel but apparently cost about the same as the flight ! The hotel is right in the middle of a quite busy street of bars, cafe's, market stalls, shops and restaurants, near the canal and main canal ! 2 minute walk fron the Jewish Ghetto and about 100 yards from the closest water bus stop, which has four different buses every 15 minutes, which take you anywhere you could possibly need to go. The hotel was really good, our room was quite small and my brothers was massive but unless your planning on staying in, it isnt a problem, the bathroom was spottless and cleaned each day ! I was worried about noise because the room was close to the reception but had no problems whatso ever. Although there where rooms which actually walked out, into the breakfast room but this was only small. The staff where brilliant, they organised restaurants each night for us to go to, that were really close but of the busy street, and where cheaper but by far the best ! Four of us ate 3 courses each with 3 bottles of wine, 207 euro's including the tip ! The hotel was about 5 - 10 minutes STROLL from St Marks Square with loads to do and see on the way. Dont be fooled by the good looking restaurants around there, they are a rip off, try the smaller ones on the alleys and side streets, and the small pizza bars and cake shops, especially the Tiramasu and Perfiteroles ! And if you see any Wine bars , they are good and cheap !!!!!!!! A good website for ideas- [--]
